UIElements.Name: Death Chance Headshot
UIElements.Tooltip: Base % chance for pilot to die when headshot. Default is 1.0=100%

UIElements.Name: Death Chance Cored
UIElements.Tooltip: Base % chance for pilot to die when Cored. Default is 0.2=20%

UIElements.Name: Death Chance Legged
UIElements.Tooltip: Base % chance for pilot to die when Legged. Default is 0.05=5%

UIElements.Name: Use Partial 'Mech Salvage V2
UIElements.Tooltip: If true partial 'Mech salvage will be of specific variants which can only be used to build this variant, or to finish building other variants. Entire mechs will not be salvagable anymore.

UIElements.Name: Mech Salvage Assembly Proficiency
UIElements.Tooltip: Determines the proficiency of the mech salvage assembly crew. The higher the value the less damage an assembled mech will have.

UIElements.Name: Item salvage chance
UIElements.Tooltip: Percent chance to salvage equipment from destroyed 'Mechs that can't be salvaged in one piece.

UIElements.Name: Salvage V1/2 'Mech salvage chance when cored
UIElements.Tooltip: Percent chance to salvage cored (CT destroyed) 'Mechs or parts of a cored 'Mech with Salvage V2.

UIElements.Name: Salvage V1/2 'Mech salvage chance when head-shot
UIElements.Tooltip: Percent chance to salvage headshotted 'Mechs or parts of a headshotted 'Mech with Salvage V2.

UIElements.Name: Salvage V1/2 'Mech salvage chance when legged
UIElements.Tooltip: Percent chance to salvage legged 'Mechs or parts of a legged 'Mech with Salvage V2.

UIElements.Name: Salvage V1 'Mech salvage assembly cost multiplier per part
UIElements.Tooltip: Scales the cost to assemble a new 'Mech per part. Old fixed value was 25000 C-Bills. This setting changes the base cost (default is 4* - 100k C-Bills per part). Now V1 assembled 'Mechs come with complete loadout like V2.

UIElements.Name: Difficulty: No weapons and equipment in assembled 'Mechs
UIElements.Tooltip: If true assembled 'Mechs in mech salvage V1 will be empty without any weapons or equipment.

UIElements.Name: Salvage V1: Allow Complete 'Mech Salvage
UIElements.Tooltip: If true complete 'Mechs can be salvaged in Salvage V1 system based on the chances set below. If false, only partial 'Mech Salvage Items can be received.

UIElements.Name: Salvage V1 'Mech salvage chance
UIElements.Tooltip: Percent chance to salvage destroyed 'Mechs without specific condition.

UIElements.Name: Salvage V1 'Mech salvage item rarity
UIElements.Tooltip: Amount of 'Mech Salvage items an otherwise unsalvageable 'Mech drops, based on weight. 0 few - 5 lots; 3 is the default, meaning a headshot results in enough salvage for a full 'Mech (in Salvage V2 subject to the headshot percentage).

UIElements.Name: Salvage V1 'Mech salvage assembly scaling
UIElements.Tooltip: Scales the number of 'Mech salvage parts required to assemble a new 'Mech. Sets the number of parts required per 5 tons.

UIElements.Name: Difficulty: Salvage V2 required mech parts
UIElements.Tooltip: The number of 'Mech parts that are required to assemble a 'Mech from salvaged parts.

UIElements.Name: Difficulty: Salvage V2 required variant parts
UIElements.Tooltip:
A factor for the number of parts required of the variant to be assembled (always rounded down).
0.5 means that half of the parts need to match the variant to be assembled, the rest can be any variant.

UIElements.Name: Difficulty: No weapons and equipment in assembled mechs
UIElements.Tooltip: If true assembled 'mechs in mech salvage V2 will be empty without any weapons or equipment.

UIElements.Name: Weapon count needed for upgrade
UIElements.Tooltip: Base number of weapons needed to ugrade a tier. Actual number is Tier+Count (1 minimum): T0->T1: 0+X, T3->T4 3+X etc. Default: 2

UIElements.Name: 'Equipment C-Bill price multiplier
UIElements.Tooltip: Equipment items, ammo and internals C-Bill price multiplier for an easier or harder financial gameplay. Requires to save the game then restart MW5 and load the created savegame to apply.

UIElements.Name: 'Mech and Pilot upkeep multiplier
UIElements.Tooltip: 'Mech and Pilot upkeep cost multiplier for an easier or harder financial gameplay.

UIElements.Name: Pay upkeep for Cold Storage
UIElements.Tooltip: All 'Mechs in Cold Storage will cost 1/10 of their normal upkeep cost per quarter for a harder financial gameplay.

UIElements.Name: Pay extra upkeep for 'Mech value in Active Roster
UIElements.Tooltip:
All 'Mechs in in Active Roster will have the percent of their total market sell value added to their normal
upkeep cost per quarter for a harder financial gameplay. 0.0 is off, 2.0 is 2 percent.

UIElements.Name: Equipment Refit Cost Scaling
UIElements.Tooltip: Allows to scale the cost of installing equipment for an easier or harder financial gameplay.

UIElements.Name: Weapon Refit Cost Scaling
UIElements.Tooltip: Allows to scale the cost of installing weapons for an easier or harder financial gameplay.

UIElements.Name: Filter market by rarity
UIElements.Tooltip: If true markets will have their equipment stock reduced based on the rarity of the items.

UIElements.Name: All Units Available From Year 1999
UIElements.Tooltip: If true all combat units' ('Mechs, Tanks, VTOLs, Turrets) intro date is set to 1999, making them always available. Requires saving and restarting the game.

UIElements.Name: All Items Available From Year 1999
UIElements.Tooltip: If true all equipment items, weapons and ammo intro date is set to 1999, making them always available. Requires saving and restarting the game.

UIElements.Name: Keep Loadout In Cold Storage
UIElements.Tooltip: If true all installed equipment and weapons (no Upgrades) will stay on the 'Mech when it's put into Cold Storage by setting all SlotType assets set to Locked. Requires to save the game then restart MW5 and load the created savegame to apply.

UIElements.Name: Disable 'Mech Market
UIElements.Tooltip: If true no'Mechs will spawn on the Market. You might still get TOIs (ClusterToiLogic) but the 'Mech Market will be empty.

UIElements.Name: Market 'Mech Multiplier
UIElements.Tooltip: Multiplies the number of 'Mechs spawned on markets by this value.

UIElements.Name: Market Weapon Multiplier
UIElements.Tooltip: Multiplies the number of weapons spawned on markets by this value.

UIElements.Name: Disable Weapon Tiers
UIElements.Tooltip:
If true weapons will no longer have a level, there will be only one medium laser. Markets will only carry tier 1 weapons.
Enemies might still run higher level weapons but salvalge will only contain tier 1 weapons.
